contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox observatory |name = Pine Bluff Observatory |background = |image = |caption = |organization = [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]] |code = |location = [[Cross Plains (town), Wisconsin|Cross Plains, Wisconsin]] |coords = {{Coord|43.0777|-89.6717|type:landmark|display=inline,title}} |altitude = {{Convert|362|m|ft|sp=us}} |weather = |established = {{Start date|1958}} |closed = |website = {{URL|http://www.sal.wisc.edu/PBO/|Pine Bluff Observatory}} |telescope1_name = 36-Inch Telescope |telescope1_type = 0.9 m reflector |telescope2_name = 16-Inch Telescope |telescope2_type = 0.4 m reflector |telescope3_name = |telescope3_type = |telescope4_name = |telescope4_type = }} The '''Pine Bluff Observatory''' (PBO) is an [[astronomy|astronomical]] [[observatory]] located in the town of [[Cross Plains (town), Wisconsin|Cross Plains, Wisconsin]] ([[United States of America|USA]]) about {{Convert|24|km|mi|sp=us}} west of [[Madison, Wisconsin|Madison]]. PBO is owned and operated by the [[University of Wisconsin–Madison]] (UW-Madison). It opened in 1958, and is mainly used by students and faculty of UW-Madison for instruction and research. PBO also provides a facility for testing new instruments.<ref name=PBOMAIN /> Recent research conducted at PBO includes measuring the lunar sodium tail, monitoring [[circumstellar disks]] around [[Be stars]], and studying the [[interstellar medium|warm ionized medium]].<ref name=2006MIER /><ref name=2011DRAP /><ref name=2011HALF /> ==See also== * [[Washburn Observatory]] * [[List of astronomical observatories]] ==References== {{Reflist|refs= <ref name=PBOMAIN>{{cite web |title=UW Pine Bluff Observatory |url=http://www.sal.wisc.edu/PBO/ |publisher=University of Wisconsin–Madison Department of Astronomy |accessdate=2012-01-17}}</ref> <ref name=2006MIER>{{cite journal |bibcode=2006AGUFM.U41C0834M |title=The Observed Velocity Structure of the Lunar Sodium Tail |author1=Mierkiewicz |first1=E. J. |last2=Line |first2=M. R. |last3=Roesler |first3=F. L. |last4=Oliversen |first4=R. J. |volume=41 |year=2006 |pages=0834 |journal=American Geophysical Union}}</ref> <ref name=2011DRAP>{{cite journal |doi=10.1017/S1743921311010854 |title=Disk-loss and disk-renewal phases in classical Be stars – II. Detailed analysis of spectropolarimetric data |year=2011 |last1=Draper |first1=Zachary H. |last2=Wisniewski |first2=John P. |last3=Bjorkman |first3=Karen S. |last4=Bjorkman |first4=Jon E. |last5=Haubois |first5=Xavier |last6=Carciofi |first6=Alex C. |last7=Meade |first7=Marilyn R. |journal=Proceedings of the International Astronomical Union |volume=6 |pages=388|arxiv = 1101.2906 }}</ref> <ref name=2011HALF>{{cite journal |bibcode=2011AAS...21725109H |title=Studying the Temperature and Ionization State of the Warm Ionized Medium |author1=Halford |first1=Melissa |last2=Mierkiewicz |first2=E. J. |last3=Reynolds |first3=R. J. |last4=Madsen |first4=G. J. |last5=Haffner |first5=L. M. |last6=Barger |first6=K. A. |last7=Roesler |first7=F. L. |volume=217 |year=2011 |pages=25109 |journal=American Astronomical Society}}</ref> }} ==External links== * [http://www.astro.wisc.edu/ Department of Astronomy] at University of Wisconsin–Madison * [http://www.cleardarksky.com/c/PBOWIkey.html?1 Pine Bluff Observatory Clear Sky Clock] Forecasts of observing conditions. {{University of Wisconsin–Madison}} [[Category:Astronomical observatories in Wisconsin]] [[Category:University of Wisconsin–Madison]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Dane County, Wisconsin]] {{Observatory-stub}}
